data.title: Coroner: Chronic alcohol use caused CSU football legend Clark Haggans' death
data.meta_description: Haggans died in June 2023 at a private residence in Fort Collins. The Super Bowl champion remains Colorado State University's all-time sacks leader.
data.text:
Former NFL and Colorado State University linebacker Clark Haggans died of complications of chronic alcohol use, the Larimer County Coroner's Office announced Monday.

Haggans was found June 19, 2023, in a private residence in Fort Collins. His death date was listed as June 17. He was 46.

According to a Colorado State University release published after his death, Haggans had returned in recent years to Fort Collins.

Haggans was a college standout at CSU, where he played defensive end in 1996-99. His 33 career sacks remains a school record. He was inducted into the Colorado State University Athletics Hall of Fame in 2015.

Haggans played 13 seasons in the NFL after being drafted in the fifth round of the 2000 NFL draft by the Steelers. He also played for the Arizona Cardinals and San Francisco 49ers, reaching the Super Bowl with all three teams and winning Super Bowl 40 with the Steelers. He retired from football in 2013.

Haggans finished his NFL career with 520 total tackles, 46.5 sacks, five fumble recoveries and one interception.

Substance abuse help is available

If you or someone you know is struggling with substance abuse, help is available. Find resources at the following locations, among others:

Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration helpline: 800-662-4357

Colorado behavioral health resources: 211 or 866-760-6489

Larimer County Mental Health and Substance Abuse Alliance: 970-221-5551
